annotateBAM module¶

annotateBAM.annotate(almnt, genes, exon, repeat)¶

Annotate an alignment

Parameters:
  • almnt – Alignment, HTSeq.GenomicInterval
  • genes – Genes, gene[genomic_iv]=set([geneID1,geneID2,...])
  • exon – Exons, exon[genomic_iv]=set([“exon”])
  • repeat – Repeats regions, HTSeq.GenomicArrayOfSets[genomic_iv]=set([repeatID])
Returns:

Annotation string, formed as: “[gene_annot1,gene_annot2,...|.]|[exon,intron|.]|[repeat_annot|.]”. Dot (.) denotes absence of annotation.
annotateBAM.formatOutput(first, second, annotFirst, annotSecond)¶

Takes alignments’ information and creates an string fit to be printed.

Parameters:
  • first – Genomic interval, HTSeq.GenomicInterval
  • second – Genomic interval, HTSeq.GenomicInterval
  • annotFirst – Annotation of first
  • annotSecond – Annotation of second
Returns:

String of annotations, “first.chrom, first.start, first.end, first.strand, first.annot, first.jMField, second.chrom,...”
annotateBAM.getArgs()¶
annotateBAM.getGenes(gtfFile)¶

Stores genomic intervals of genes (including introns) and exons in dictionaries.

Parameters:gtfFile – GTF file.
Returns:[gene,exon] GenomicArrayOfSets, gene[genomic_iv]=set([geneID1,geneID2,...]), GenomicArrayOfSets, exon[genomic_iv]=”exon”
annotateBAM.getRepeats(rFile)¶

Stores genomic intervals of repeats as HTSeq.GenomicArrayOfSets.

Parameters:rFile – BED file with the name of repeats on 4th column.
Returns:HTSeq.GenomicArrayOfSets[genomic_iv]=set([repeatID])
